issues.title: Missing Requirement for Annual Training Documentation
issues.description: California law requires that mandated reporter training be provided annually, but the regulation only specifies training "within the first six weeks of each school year" without clearly establishing this as an annual requirement for all continuing employees. The documentation and retention requirements are present but the annual frequency for all employees needs clarification.

legal_citations.text: The training shall be provided annually to employees and persons working on behalf of the school district who are mandated reporters.

issues.required_language: All mandated reporters shall receive training annually on child abuse identification and reporting requirements. For continuing employees, this training shall be completed within the first six weeks of each school year. For new employees hired during the school year, training shall be completed within the first six weeks of employment.

issues.title: Missing Specific Training Content Requirements
issues.description: The regulation mentions training requirements but does not include all the specific content areas mandated by law, particularly regarding the legal consequences of failing to report and the specific penalties involved.

legal_citations.text: The training shall include information that failure to report an incident of known or reasonably suspected child abuse or neglect as required by Penal Code 11166 is a misdemeanor punishable by up to six months confinement in a county jail, by a fine of one thousand dollars ($1,000), or by both that imprisonment and fine.

issues.required_language: The training shall include information that failure to report an incident of known or reasonably suspected child abuse or neglect as required by law is a misdemeanor punishable by up to six months confinement in a county jail, by a fine of one thousand dollars ($1,000), or by both that imprisonment and fine.

issues.title: Missing Reference to Specific Agency Contact Information Update Requirements
issues.description: The regulation provides specific contact information for Child Protective Services but does not include language requiring regular updates to ensure accuracy of contact information, which is important for compliance with immediate reporting requirements.

legal_citations.text: Reports shall be made immediately or as soon as practicably possible by telephone to the appropriate agency.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall ensure that contact information for reporting agencies is current and accurate, and shall update this information as needed to ensure compliance with immediate reporting requirements.

issues.title: Missing Clarification on Electronic Transmission Methods
issues.description: The regulation mentions that written reports may be "electronically transmitted" but does not specify acceptable methods or security requirements for electronic transmission of sensitive child abuse reports.

legal_citations.text: The written report may be sent, faxed, or electronically transmitted to the appropriate agency.

issues.required_language: Electronic transmission of written reports shall be conducted through secure methods that protect the confidentiality of the information being transmitted, in accordance with applicable privacy laws and agency requirements.
